translated: The Story of the Elder Bhisamuḷāladāyaka
who had gone to the far shore of all things,
the Omniscient One who desired solitude,
in the Victorious One who has great compassion,
I offered him a stalk of bhisas grass,
and I was a servant of the Buddha, the Best.
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of offering bhisas.
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Bhisamuḷāladāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā bhisamuḷāladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Bhisamuḷāladāyakattherassāpadānaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā bhisamuḷāladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽bhisa muḷāla dāyaka therassa apadānam
translated: The Story of the Elder Bhisamuḷāladāyaka is the third.
